snippet: The Obama administration is considering a range of as low as 3,000 troops and as high of 9,000.
abstract: Obama administration is considering keeping force of 3,000 to 9,000 troops in Afghanistan after 2014; new options under consideration are smaller than 6,000 to 20,000 troops Gen John R Allen, American commander in Afghanistan, is said to have previously suggested.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is considering a range of as low as 3,000 troops and as high of 9,000.

headline.main: U.S. Weighs Fewer Troops After 2014 in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Weighs Fewer Troops After 2014 In Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
